body_html:
I think the shape has been correctly inferred with the most recent master:

ubuntu@ubuntu:~/$ python
Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 19 2016, 06:48:10) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> n = 1
>>> x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
>>> shp = tf.shape(x)
>>> noise = tf.random_normal(shp, mean=0, stddev=1)
>>> print(noise.get_shape())
(?, ?, 1)
>>> n = 2
>>> x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
>>> shp = tf.shape(x)
>>> noise = tf.random_normal(shp, mean=0, stddev=1)
>>> print(noise.get_shape())
(?, ?, 2)
>>>

Maybe this issue could be closed?

body:
I think the shape has been correctly inferred with the most recent master:
```
ubuntu@ubuntu:~/$ python
Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 19 2016, 06:48:10) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> n = 1
>>> x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
>>> shp = tf.shape(x)
>>> noise = tf.random_normal(shp, mean=0, stddev=1)
>>> print(noise.get_shape())
(?, ?, 1)
>>> n = 2
>>> x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, None, n), name='x')
>>> shp = tf.shape(x)
>>> noise = tf.random_normal(shp, mean=0, stddev=1)
>>> print(noise.get_shape())
(?, ?, 2)
>>> 
```

Maybe this issue could be closed?
